title: Auto emission norms to get stricter, make cars costlier
description: India's automakers face stricter carbon emissions norms, requiring a 30% reduction over three years or penalties. The Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) proposed CAFE 3 norms effective from April 2027, with CAFE 4 norms following. CAFE 3 aims for 91.7 gm CO2/km and CAFE 4 for 70 gm CO2/km. Automakers get a five-year transition to CAFE 4, but compliance challenges remain, including pricing affordable low-emission vehicles. Penalties for non-compliance are stiff, encouraging more fuel-efficient cars.
